These developers tend to produce quality turn-based games with very good depth to them.  This game--a turn-based squad combat game with an RPG overlay--is of similar, good build quality.  Their approach to in-app purchases tends to be one-off-not-major-revenue-driver--similar to a DLC or minor expansion set style purchase, rather than the constant-buy approach seen in some other developers (DungeonKeeper comes to mind).  They also tend to actively maintain their game, with regular releases of bug fixes, minor content addition, balance tweaks, and so forth.  Dialog and plot tends to be well above average for a mobile game and comparable to a solid-but-not-fantastic PC game--similar to, say, the writing in the old SSI gold box games, or the mid/late 1990's FF games (Final Fantasy IV, V, or VI), or a mid-quality AD&D 2nd edition adventure.  It's not at the level of Fallout or Baldur's Gate (both incredibly well written and plotted) but more like Bard's Tale (original) or Eternal Dagger or the better Eamon adventures.  In other words--definitely worth the price and I hope to see more such software from these developers in the future.
